meanings.definition: To oversee or direct (a project or activity)
meanings.sent1: The teacher superintends the science fair to ensure everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She superintends the construction of the new playground in the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat superintends the birdhouse building, making sure no birds get inside.
meanings.sent4: The mother superintends the family dinner like a skilled conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: He superintends the garden with a watchful eye, like a guardian protecting a treasure.

meanings.definition: To be in charge of or manage (a group of people)
meanings.sent1: The principal superintends the school staff and students.
meanings.sent2: He superintends a team of engineers working on the new bridge design.
meanings.sent3: The dog superintends the playdate, making sure everyone plays nicely.
meanings.sent4: She superintends her employees with a firm but fair hand.
meanings.sent5: The coach superintends the soccer team, guiding them to victory.

meanings.definition: To supervise or control (a process or operation)
meanings.sent1: The manager superintends the production line to ensure efficiency.
meanings.sent2: She superintends the quality control of the products before they are shipped.
meanings.sent3: The robot superintends the assembly line, making sure all parts fit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: He superintends the software update, ensuring no errors occur.
meanings.sent5: The chef superintends the kitchen like a master orchestrating a culinary symphony.
